title: frijolito
author: frijolito
content: Hello everyone, my question is quite simple. I have been slowly buying bitcoin for a few years (small amounts) and now I have enough to buy some ASICs. I always wanted to buy one but I'm pretty stingy and I don't like to spend money. But lately and researching the price of electricity in my country and the price of an antminer I decided to buy one. I found an antminer s9j on amazon for 260USD (shipping included) and an Antminer S19j for 2000USD. The truth is that both would end up paying off in approximately 1 year, so I don't really know which one to buy. What do you think would be best for someone new?I also found a used s15 on amazon but I don't know if I trust it much since it has 2.5 stars and finally the having is next year they think it will make it difficult for someone who does not have a mining farm "in good condition" (asic number and constant inconme of this)Thank you so much

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: frijolito on August 11, 2023, 08:05:12 PMHello everyone, my question is quite simple. I have been slowly buying bitcoin for a few years (small amounts) and now I have enough to buy some ASICs. I always wanted to buy one but I'm pretty stingy and I don't like to spend money. But lately and researching the price of electricity in my country and the price of an antminer I decided to buy one. I found an antminer s9j on amazon for 260USD (shipping included) and an Antminer S19j for 2000USD. The truth is that both would end up paying off in approximately 1 year, so I don't really know which one to buy. What do you think would be best for someone new?I also found a used s15 on amazon but I don't know if I trust it much since it has 2.5 stars and finally the having is next year they think it will make it difficult for someone who does not have a mining farm "in good condition" (asic number and constant inconme of this)Thank you so muchthe s9j wants 120 volt powerthe s15 wants 230 volt power the s19 wants 230 volt powerA lot depends on your heatÂ  removal issues. can you stand to burn 3000 watts for the s19 and listen to a loud unit?you can run the s19 with braiins at 2475 watts it is not too loud.Â  but it is not quiet here is one running with braiins and a down clock

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It also depends on your Electricity rate the s9j consumed 0.093j/Gh, s19j 0.036j/Gh, and s15 0.057j/Gh.So for better efficiency then choose s19j if you have almost free electricity then choose s9j it consumed more power but if you have a very cheap electricity rate you can make a better profit with this unit.

comments.author: ZeusBtc.com
comments.body: I'm glad you decided to work with Bitcoin mining. In addition to the electricity cost, power consumption, and noise mentioned above, you also need to pay attention to whether there are technicians nearby who can provide miner repair services. If you canâ€™t repair it yourself, and there is no local repair center, sending the machine to other regions for repair may be risky and expensive in case of failure.

comments.author: EastCoastASICRepair
comments.body: 2000 for a S19j is pricey in the current market. We have used 95th model available for 850USD

comments.author: hymperion
comments.body: Not knowing how much you pay for electricity makes it difficult to make calculations. An s9 and an s19 are totally different. With an s9 and $0.04 kw you already earn nothing

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Hi guys. I have no idea in regards to mining, but I am willing to learn. I checked this website: https://minetheasic.com/?BTCI saw that with an estimate of $0.1/KWH the S9 is actually losing money instead of earning. Am I correct?

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: ASIC S9 has not been used in mining for a long time, even with the availability of free electricity.With such ASICs, you will spend more time on constant repairs and troubleshooting, and in the end there will be no profit.ASIC S19 with firmware can be used at an electricity price of 4 cents.
